intro: Salvadora, commonly known as toothbrush tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Salicaceae. It is native to regions of Asia, Africa, and the Middle East, and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and distinctive, often aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with bark that can be smooth or fissured depending on the species. Salvadora species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry climates with minimal water requirements. Its botanical features make it an important plant in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
